Class BHPointGroup

java.lang.Object
  BHPointGroup
Direct Known Subclasses:
BHPolygon
public class BHPointGroup
extends java.lang.Object

BHPointGroup is a simple container for an ensemble of BHPoint objects. This is intended to act like Vector, but simplify the getting as an array - .toArray() seems like overkill besides - this now makes the collection of points similar to the contours. Original label associations can be found in the label attribute of each point.

Contact: Mike Sieracki, msieracki@bigelow.org
Author: Ben Tupper, btupper@bigelow.org
History: Developed over the course of 2009 and 2010 using ImageJ 1.43 and Mac OSX 10.5.8
at Bigelow Laboratory for Ocean Science, www.bigelow.org

getCentroidDistance

public double[] getCentroidDistance()

getRotatedRaw

public double[][] getRotatedRaw(double xc,
                                double yc,
                                double angle)
rotates the points about the specified centroid by the specified angle See Horn 1986. Instead of rotating this polygon, it simply returns the rotated coords as [nvertices][2] - this type of contour only handles integer type coords even though the returned coords are double Coordinates are untransformed by scale - thus they are "raw" - be sure that xc and yc inputs are also untransformed

Parameters:
xc - The unscaled x coordinate of the centroid
yc - The unscaled y coordinate of the centroid
angle - the angle in radians about which to rotate
